caseTitle: Commissioner of Income Tax Karachi v. M/s. Hassan Associates (Pvt) Ltd.
authorJudge: MR. JUSTICE MIAN SAQIB NISAR, CJ
tagline: The forfeiture of an amount under a contract cannot be equated with a fine or penalty incurred due to infraction or violation of any law. An amount paid as damages or compensation is an expenditure, a revenue loss, incurred in the course of carrying on the business and therefore is an admissible deduction under section 23(2)(xviii) of the Income Tax Ordinance, 1979.
